data.title: Apple reveals App Store takedown demands by governments
data.text: For the first time, Apple has published the number of requests it’s received from governments to take down apps from its app store.

data.title: One signal shows the S&P 500 and Apple can surge double digits: Cramer
data.text: Chart action suggests the market could pull back later this week, but analyst Carolyn Boroden is bullish about long-term prospects, Cramer says.

data.title: Why Apple Was 'Clear Winner' in G-20 Trade Truce
data.text: Dan Ives, Wedbush Securities managing director, Krishna Memani, OFI chief investment officer at Invesco, and Steve Chiavarone, portfolio manager at Federated Investors, discuss the outlook for Apple Inc. on "Bloomberg Markets: The Open."

data.title: Apple Sans Ive
data.text: Well, this has been interesting. After almost 30 years with Apple, Jony Ive is leaving, to found his own firm LoveFrom with his friend and frequent collaborator Marc Newson — also leaving Apple.

data.title: Tuesday Apple Rumors: iPhone With Fingerprint Sensor Under Screen May Come to China
data.text: Tuesday's Apple Rumors include the release of new betas for developers, approval from the FCC for a new MacBook Pro model and more.

data.title: Tim Cook firebacks about tension between Apple and chief designer Jony Ive
data.text: Apple CEO Tim Cook denies reports about tension between Apple's former chief designer Jony Ive who recently left the company.

data.title: Apple Services Chief Shares More TV+ Details
Apple is a cash cow that should be a core holding in everyone's portfolio, says Richard Saperstein
data.text: Kari Firestone, Auerus Asset Management, and Richard Saperstein, Hightower Treasury Partners CIO, joins the "Fast Money Halftime Report" team to discuss if Apple can go onto new highs following the departure of its chief design officer Jony Ive.

data.title: Apple Third-Quarter Earnings: Mark Your Calendar
data.text: Can the tech giant return to growth?

data.title: The Verge's editor-in-chief on Jony Ive's departure: 'The change is good'
data.text: The Verge editor-in-chief Nilay Patel joins "Squawk Alley" to discuss Jony Ive's departure from Apple and a report from the Wall Street Journal that Tim Cook called "absurd.

data.title: Apple's loyal user base is its leverage for more sales, says analyst
data.text: Walter Piecyk, TMT analyst at BTIG, and Charles Bobrinskoy, vice chairman and head of investment group at Ariel Investments, join "Squawk Alley" to discuss Apple's market rally.

data.title: Apple Is Losing Its Visionary Designer
data.text: Jony Ive is leaving behind a legacy of breakthrough products.

data.title: Irish regulator opens third privacy probe into Apple
data.text: Apple's  main regulator in the European Union, Ireland's Data Protection Commissioner (DPC), has opened a third privacy investigation into the iPhone maker over the last few weeks, a spokesman for the DPC said on Tuesday.

data.title: Tim Cook blasts WSJ report on Jony Ive departure
data.text: Jony Ive, Apple's chief design officer, announced he was leaving the tech giant to form his own design firm that will continue to work closely with Apple.

data.title: Tim Cook's defense of Jony Ive signals a new era at Apple
data.text: Apple's CEO Tim Cook responded to a critical Wall Street Journal story about Jony Ive's departure from the company in an email to NBC News. Cook's letter defends his legacy at Apple.

data.title: CNBC's 'Trading Nation' Weighs In On Apple's Recent Run
data.text: On CNBC’s "Trading Nation," Matt Maley of Miller Tabak said Apple Inc. (NASDAQ: AAPL) is at a key technical juncture after rallying 16% in the past month.

data.title: If Apple fails at this level, it would be a 'big problem' for the stock, technician says
data.text: Apple shares raced into July, but now its rally faces a major test, says technician. Here's what could make or break its rally.

data.title: Tim Cook: WSJ report on tensions with Jony Ive is 'absurd'
data.text: Jony Ive, Apple's chief design officer, announced he was the company to form his own design firm that will continue to work closely with Apple.
